title.narrative: 5.3 EDUCATION IN EMERGENCY

description.narrative: 2013-15 Output 5.3 By 2015, national and sub-national capacity in disaster risk management enhanced to respond effectively to emergency including long- term strategies relating to Education CCCs.2011-13 Intermediate Results (IR) 8.3 By 2015, heuristic (student centred) teaching method is practiced in primary schools along with the improved teaching and learning materials and ICT., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2013-16: Outcome 5: By 2016, revised national policy on quality standards implemented for equitable access and utilization of pre- primary, primary and secondary education including in humanitarian situation. 2011-13: Programme Component Results (PCR) 8: By 2015, national and sub- national capacity is in place to deliver quality education services to children in kindergartens and primary and secondary schools.

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

description.narrative: Country office is working on cash conservation mode and has prioritized life saving interventions that does not include this output. | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:26/09/2016

title.narrative: Number of kindergartens and schools affected by natural disaster supported for rehabilitation and that are equipped with basic teaching-learning materials.
Proportion of education materials agreed with operational partners and meeting prescribed standards/norms prepositioned at central level to respond during new emergencies.
Percent of vulnerable counties (30) supported by UNICEF and operational partners in capacity development of key officials on disaster risk reduction related to Education CCC.
